content:
_MethodInfo Interface

Definition

Exposes the public members of the MethodInfo class to unmanaged code.

In this Article

[System.CLSCompliant(false)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("FFCC1B5D-ECB8-38DD-9B01-3DC8ABC2AA5F")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.TypeLibImportClass(typeof(System.Reflection.MethodInfo))]
public interface _MethodInfo

Remarks

This interface is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

This interface preserves the vtable order of the System.Reflection.MethodInfo class members that can be accessed by unmanaged COM objects.

Properties

Attributes

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.Attributes* property.

public System.Reflection.MethodAttributes Attributes { get; }
Value
MethodAttributes

One of the MethodAttributes values.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The Attributes property gets the attributes associated with this method.

CallingConvention

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.CallingConvention* property.

public System.Reflection.CallingConventions CallingConvention { get; }
Value
CallingConventions

One of the CallingConventions values.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The CallingConvention property gets a value indicating the calling conventions for this method.

DeclaringType

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.DeclaringType* property.

public Type DeclaringType { get; }
Value
Type

The Type object for the class that declares this member.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The DeclaringType property gets the class that declares this member.

IsAbstract

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsAbstract* property.

public bool IsAbstract { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the method is abstract; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsAbstract property gets a value indicating whether the method is abstract.

IsAssembly

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsAssembly* property.

public bool IsAssembly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this method can be called by other classes in the same assembly; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsAssembly property gets a value indicating whether this method can be called by other classes in the same assembly

IsConstructor

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsConstructor* property.

public bool IsConstructor { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this method is a constructor; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsConstructor property gets a value indicating whether the method is a constructor.

IsFamily

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsFamily* property.

public bool IsFamily { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if access to the class is restricted to members of the class itself and to members of its derived classes; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsFamily property gets a value indicating whether access to this method is restricted to members of the class and members of its derived classes.

IsFamilyAndAssembly

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsFamilyAndAssembly* property.

public bool IsFamilyAndAssembly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if access to this method is restricted to members of the class itself and to members of derived classes that are in the same assembly; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsFamilyAndAssembly property gets a value indicating whether this method can be called by members of the class itself and derived classes if they are in the same assembly

IsFamilyOrAssembly

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsFamilyOrAssembly* property.

public bool IsFamilyOrAssembly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if access to this method is restricted to members of the class itself, members of derived classes wherever they are, and members of other classes in the same assembly; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsFamilyOrAssembly property gets a value indicating whether this method can be called by derived classes, wherever they are, and by all classes in the same assembly.

IsFinal

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsFinal* property.

public bool IsFinal { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this method is final; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsFinal property gets a value indicating whether this method is final.

IsHideBySig

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsHideBySig* property.

public bool IsHideBySig { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the member is hidden by signature; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsHideBySig property gets a value indicating whether only a member of the same name with exactly the same signature is hidden in the derived class.

IsPrivate

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsPrivate* property.

public bool IsPrivate { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if access to this method is restricted to other members of the class itself; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsPrivate property gets a value indicating whether this member is private.

IsPublic

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsPublic* property.

public bool IsPublic { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this method is public; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsPublic property gets a value indicating whether this method is public.

IsSpecialName

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsSpecialName* property.

public bool IsSpecialName { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this method has a special name; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsSpecialName property gets a value indicating whether this method has a special name.

IsStatic

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsStatic* property.

public bool IsStatic { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this method is static; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsStatic property gets a value indicating whether the method is static.

IsVirtual

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.IsVirtual* property.

public bool IsVirtual { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this method is virtual; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsVirtual property gets a value indicating whether the method is virtual.

MemberType

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.MemberType* property.

public System.Reflection.MemberTypes MemberType { get; }
Value
MemberTypes

One of the MemberTypes values indicating the type of member.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The MemberType property gets a MemberTypes value indicating the type of the member — method, constructor, event, and so on.

MethodHandle

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.MethodHandle* property.

public RuntimeMethodHandle MethodHandle { get; }
Value
RuntimeMethodHandle

A RuntimeMethodHandle object.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The MethodHandle property gets a handle to the internal metadata representation of a method.

Name

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.Name* property.

public string Name { get; }
Value
String

A String object containing the name of this member.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The Name property gets the name of the current member.

ReflectedType

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.ReflectedType* property.

public Type ReflectedType { get; }
Value
Type

The Type object that was used to obtain this MemberInfo object.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The ReflectedType property gets the class object that was used to obtain this MemberInfo object.

ReturnType

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodInfo.ReturnType* property.

public Type ReturnType { get; }
Value
Type

The return type of this method.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The ReturnType property gets the return type of this method.

ReturnTypeCustomAttributes

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodInfo.ReturnTypeCustomAttributes* property.

public System.Reflection.ICustomAttributeProvider ReturnTypeCustomAttributes { get; }
Value
ICustomAttributeProvider

An ICustomAttributeProvider object representing the custom attributes for the return type.

Remarks

This property is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The ReturnTypeCustomAttributes property gets the custom attributes for the return type.

Methods

Equals(Object)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.Equals* method.

public bool Equals (object other);
other
Object

The Object to compare with the current Object.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified Object is equal to the current Object; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The Equals method determines whether the specified Object is equal to the current Object.

GetBaseDefinition()

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodInfo.GetBaseDefinition* method.

public System.Reflection.MethodInfo GetBaseDefinition ();
Returns
MethodInfo

A MethodInfo object for the first implementation of this method.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The GetBaseDefinition method returns the MethodInfo object for the method on the direct or indirect base class in which the method represented by this instance was first declared.

GetCustomAttributes(Boolean)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.GetCustomAttributes* method.

public object[] GetCustomAttributes (bool inherit);
inherit
Boolean

true to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes; otherwise, false.

Returns
Object[]

An array that contains all the custom attributes, or an array with zero (0) elements if no attributes are defined.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The GetCustomAttributes method returns an array containing all the custom attributes.

GetCustomAttributes(Type,Boolean)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.GetCustomAttributes* method.

public object[] GetCustomAttributes (Type attributeType, bool inherit);
attributeType
Type

The type of attribute to search for. Only attributes that are assignable to this type are returned.

inherit
Boolean

true to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes; otherwise, false.

Returns
Object[]

An array of custom attributes applied to this member, or an array with zero (0) elements if no attributes have been applied.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The GetCustomAttributes method returns an array of custom attributes identified by Type.

GetHashCode()

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.GetHashCode* method.

public int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

The hash code for the current instance.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The GetHashCode method serves as a hash function for a particular type. GetHashCode is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.

GetIDsOfNames(Guid,IntPtr,UInt32,UInt32,IntPtr)

Maps a set of names to a corresponding set of dispatch identifiers.

public void GetIDsOfNames (ref Guid riid, IntPtr rgszNames, uint cNames, uint lcid, IntPtr rgDispId);
riid
Guid

Reserved for future use. Must be IID_NULL.

rgszNames
IntPtr

An array of names to be mapped.

cNames
UInt32

The count of the names to be mapped.

lcid
UInt32

The locale context in which to interpret the names.

rgDispId
IntPtr

An array allocated by the caller that receives the identifiers corresponding to the names.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code. For more information about IDispatch::GetIDsOfNames, see the MSDN Library.

GetMethodImplementationFlags()

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.GetMethodImplementationFlags* method.

public System.Reflection.MethodImplAttributes GetMethodImplementationFlags ();
Returns
MethodImplAttributes

One of the MethodImplAttributes values.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The GetMethodImplementationFlags member returns the MethodImplAttributes flags.

GetParameters()

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.GetParameters* method.

public System.Reflection.ParameterInfo[] GetParameters ();
Returns
ParameterInfo[]

An array of type ParameterInfo containing information that matches the signature of the method (or constructor) reflected by this instance.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The GetParameters method gets the parameters of the specified method or constructor.

GetType()

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Type.GetType* method.

public Type GetType ();
Returns
Type

A Type object.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The GetType method gets the type of the current instance.

GetTypeInfo(UInt32,UInt32,IntPtr)

Retrieves the type information for an object, which can be used to get the type information for an interface.

public void GetTypeInfo (uint iTInfo, uint lcid, IntPtr ppTInfo);
iTInfo
UInt32

The type information to return.

lcid
UInt32

The locale identifier for the type information.

ppTInfo
IntPtr

A pointer to the requested type information object.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code. For more information about IDispatch::GetTypeInfo, see the MSDN Library.

GetTypeInfoCount(UInt32)

Retrieves the number of type information interfaces that an object provides (either 0 or 1).

public void GetTypeInfoCount (out uint pcTInfo);
pcTInfo
UInt32

When this method returns, contains a pointer to a location that receives the number of type information interfaces provided by the object. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code. For more information about IDispatch::GetTypeInfoCount, see the MSDN Library.

Invoke(Object,Object[])

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.Invoke* method.

public object Invoke (object obj, object[] parameters);
obj
Object

The instance that created this method.

parameters
Object[]

An argument list for the invoked method or constructor. This is an array of objects with the same number, order, and type as the parameters of the method or constructor to be invoked. If there are no parameters, parameters should be null.

If the method or constructor represented by this instance takes a ref parameter (ByRef in Visual Basic), no special attribute is required for that parameter to invoke the method or constructor using this function. Any object in this array that is not explicitly initialized with a value will contain the default value for that object type. For reference type elements, this value is null. For value type elements, this value is 0, 0.0, or false, depending on the specific element type.

Returns
Object

An instance of the class associated with the constructor.

Remarks

The Invoke method invokes the method or constructor represented by this object, using the specified parameters.

Invoke(Object,BindingFlags,Binder,Object[],CultureInfo)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MethodBase.Invoke* method.

public object Invoke (object obj, System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, object[] parameters, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture);
obj
Object

The instance that created this method.

invokeAttr
BindingFlags

One of the BindingFlags values that specifies the type of binding.

binder
Binder

A Binder that defines a set of properties and enables the binding, coercion of argument types, and invocation of members using reflection. If binder is null, then Binder.DefaultBinding is used.

parameters
Object[]

An array of type Object used to match the number, order, and type of the parameters for this constructor, under the constraints of binder. If this constructor does not require parameters, pass an array with zero elements, as in Object[] parameters = new Object[0]. Any object in this array that is not explicitly initialized with a value will contain the default value for that object type. For reference type elements, this value is null. For value type elements, this value is 0, 0.0, or false, depending on the specific element type.

culture
CultureInfo

A CultureInfo object used to govern the coercion of types. If this is null, the CultureInfo for the current thread is used.

Returns
Object

An instance of the class associated with the constructor.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The Invoke method invokes the constructor reflected by this ConstructorInfo object with the specified arguments, under the constraints of the specified Binder object.

Invoke(UInt32,Guid,UInt32,Int16,IntPtr,IntPtr,IntPtr,IntPtr)

Provides access to properties and methods exposed by an object.

public void Invoke (uint dispIdMember, ref Guid riid, uint lcid, short wFlags, IntPtr pDispParams, IntPtr pVarResult, IntPtr pExcepInfo, IntPtr puArgErr);
dispIdMember
UInt32

An identifier for the member.

riid
Guid

Reserved for future use. Must be IID_NULL.

lcid
UInt32

The locale context in which to interpret arguments.

wFlags
Int16

Flags describing the context of the call.

pDispParams
IntPtr

A pointer to a structure containing an array of arguments, an array of argument DISPIDs for named arguments, and counts for the number of elements in the arrays.

pVarResult
IntPtr

A pointer to the location where the result will be stored.

pExcepInfo
IntPtr

A pointer to a structure that contains exception information.

puArgErr
IntPtr

The index of the first argument that has an error.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code. For more information about IDispatch::Invoke, see the MSDN Library.

IsDefined(Type,Boolean)

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Reflection.MemberInfo.IsDefined* method.

public bool IsDefined (Type attributeType, bool inherit);
attributeType
Type

The Type object to which the custom attributes are applied.

inherit
Boolean

true to search this member's inheritance chain to find the attributes; otherwise, false.

Returns
Boolean

true if one or more instance of the attributeType parameter is applied to this member; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.

The IsDefined member indicates whether one or more instances of the attributeType parameter are applied to this member.

ToString()

Provides COM objects with version-independent access to the stem.Object.ToString* method.

public string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string that represents the current Object.

Remarks

This method is for access to managed classes from unmanaged code and should not be called from managed code.
